Wow, Josh. Thanks for the brain dump! I'm trying to write my first 
RESTful application, and your concrete examples are enlightening.

>    i/    I don't want a tool that autogenerates data-carrier
>          objects: there's already too many of them, and they
>          all suck.
> 
>    ii/   I personally don't want to deal with XML-enabled
>          objects anymore.

What do you mean when you say "XML-enabled"? And is this in 
reference to the data-carrier objects, or something else?

What would you prefer over XML-enabled objects?

Thanks!

> ...jsled

Matt Garland
